723628f-a.title: Manhattan: Union Square - 14th Street (East) - Broadway - [Union Square Park.]
723628f-a.text:
Classification: Parks
Union Square, at East 14th Street and Broadway, northward, showing Union Square West (B'way) on the left, and Union Scuare East (4th Ave.) on the right. Buildings observed across Union Square Park, are on the north side of East 17th Street. The Metropolitan tower appears across the skyline.
October 1924.
General Electric Company.
Neg. 2554
723628f-a.folder: Union Square & 14th Street (East) & Broadway & [Union Square Park.], Manhattan, NY

711248f-a.text:
East 14th Street, south side, at Broadway, as photographed southwestward from Union Square East (4th Ave.) and 15th Street.  The ornate building at the S.W. corner was demolished and replaced with a modern office structure.  Adjoining same is the women's finishing house of Orbachs.  It remains after absorption of the adjacent building occupied by Abels.  Note the equestrian Washington statue at the left.  This was removed to a new site inside of the park.
January 30, 1928
P.L. Sperr

730231f-a.title: General view - [Manhattan - 14th Street - Broadway (Northeast).]
730231f-a.text:
A general view, northeast from 14th Street, at the northeast corner of Broadway.
August 4, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

730232f-a.title: General view - [Manhattan - 14th Street - Broadway (Southeast).]
730232f-a.text:
A general view, southeast, from 14th Street and Broadway.
August 4, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

711247f-a.text: East 14th Street, south side, east from Broadway (right) to Fourth Avenue (left).  The Rogers Peet & Co. Bldg. shown, occupies the southerly half of this block, utilizing the 13th Street side.  June 15, 1938.  P.L. Sperr.

The view includes the S.E. corner of Union Square, as shown in the foreground.
September 23, 1930
